sentence.Network_en: One secret he learned very early on was not to flaunt his success.
sentence.Network_cn: 他很早就学到的一个秘诀就是不要夸耀自己的成功。

sentence.Network_en: Flaunt your age and you must not have much longer to live.
He flaunts his queer style as a savage might flaunt a top - hat retrieved from somebody's dustbin.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对自己那种怪异的文体加以夸耀这恰似一个野人从别人的垃圾箱里捡出一顶礼帽时那种洋洋得意的样子.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 字典中耀字的解释 ... (2) 同本义[ shine;illuminate] (5) 炫耀[ flaunt;boast of] (7) 显示;显耀[ show].
标字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 标准像〖 officialportrait〗 标榜〖 flaunt;advertise〗 标榜自由平等〖 boost;praiseexcessively〗.

英语单词的奥秘 - luozhong10的日志 - 网易博客 ... fish（ 鱼）； flaunt（ 飘扬，招展）； fiery（ 燃烧的，火似的）；.

list.abs: she openly flaunted her affair with the senator ., 她公开夸耀和参议员的恋情.
to flaunt myself by your high branches ., 借你的高枝炫耀自己.
She came into school flaunting her new red dress ., 她来学校炫耀她的新的红裙子.
his behavior was an outrageous flaunt ., 他的行为是一种无耻的炫耀.

phrase.cizu_name: if you've got it, flaunt it

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)one should make a conspicuous and confident show of one's wealth or attributes rather than be modest about them
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)有了（财富，品质），就要表现出来；有则显之

entry.def: If you say that someone flaunts their possessions, abilities, or qualities, you mean that they display them in a very obvious way, especially in order to try to obtain other people's admiration.

example.ex: They drove around in Rolls-Royces, openly flaunting their wealth...
example.tran: 他们开着劳斯莱斯到处转悠，公开炫耀他们的财富。

example.ex: One secret he learned very early on was not to flaunt his success.
example.tran: 他很早就学到的一个秘诀就是不要夸耀自己的成功。

entry.tran: 招摇过市;卖弄性感;搔首弄姿
entry.def: If you say that someone is flaunting themselves, you disapprove of them because they are behaving in a very confident way, or in a way that is intended to attract sexual attention.

example.ex: She's asking for trouble, flaunting herself like that. Did you see the way Major Winston was looking at her?
example.tran: 她那么招摇，真是在自找麻烦。看到温斯顿少校看她的样子了吗？

example.ex: ...tourists flaunting themselves in front of the castle guards in bra and shorts.
example.tran: 穿着文胸和短裤在城堡卫兵面前招摇卖弄的游客们

means.word_mean: 1. the act of displaying something ostentatiously;
1. display proudly; act ostentatiously or pretentiously;

sentences.sentence: "he showed off his new sports car"

auth_sentence.content: The new music was produced primarily to flaunt their vocal chops.
auth_sentence.res_content: The new music was produced primarily to flaunt their vocal chops.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The new music was produced primarily to flaunt their vocal chops.

auth_sentence.content: Competitors wishing to flaunt their big air skills are advised to get there early.
auth_sentence.res_content: Competitors wishing to flaunt their big air skills are advised to get there early.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Competitors wishing to flaunt their big air skills are advised to get there early.

auth_sentence.content: He has also played to nostalgia for the Soviet era, when officials were afraid to flaunt what wealth they had.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has also played to nostalgia for the Soviet era, when officials were afraid to flaunt what wealth they had.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has also played to nostalgia for the Soviet era, when officials were afraid to flaunt what wealth they had.

sentences.en: She was flaunting her new fur coat.
sentences.cn: 她正在夸耀她那件新的皮大衣。

means.word_mean: 有什么能耐就施展出来

sentences.en: Don’t worry about what other people think! As my grandmother always used to say, ‘if you’ve got it, flaunt it’!
sentences.cn: 别担心别人怎么想！就像我祖母常说的那样，有什么能耐就施展出来！
